RESILIENCE.Definition: the ability to recover quickly from difficulties or challenges

SHAKING.Definition: moving or vibrating with small, quick movements

GOING WITH THE FLOW.Definition: adapting or accepting the situation as it develops

CLAIMED.Definition: declared ownership or possession of it

EPIC.Definition: grand or heroic, like an impressive adventure or story

CREW.Definition: group of people who worked together on a ship

CLAIM.Definition: declare ownership or possession of it

PERISHED.Definition: died, especially in a tragic or untimely manner

STARVATION.Definition: the state of extreme hunger or lack of food

LACK.Definition: the fact of not having enough or being without

ITCHY.Definition: eager or restless, having a strong desire or urge

APPROPRIATELY.Definition: in a suitable or fitting manner

HEEDED.Definition: listened to or paid attention to

MINIMISE.Definition: reduce or make it as small as possible

SETTING SAIL.Definition: beginning the journey by boat or ship

PICKAXES.Definition: tools with a pointed end used for breaking ice or rock

SHOVELS.Definition: tools with a broad, flat blade used for lifting and moving materials like snow or soil

AT THE MERCY OF.Definition: vulnerable or dependent on the actions of

BACKUP.Definition: reserve or secondary option in case the primary one fails

SLEDGES.Definition: sled-like vehicles used for transportation over ice or snow

KEENLY.Definition: to a large degree, very well

LAGGING.Definition: falling behind or not keeping up

PASS IT OFF AS.Definition: pretend or present it as if it were

CRUSHING.Definition: pressing or squeezing with great force or pressure

SEEP.Definition: flow or leak slowly through small openings or cracks

SANK.Definition: descended or went down below the surface of water

BID FAREWELL.Definition: said goodbye or parted ways with

MELTED.Definition: became liquid by the application of heat or warmth

SINK.Definition: go down or descend beneath the surface of water

MELT.Definition: become liquid by the application of heat or warmth

SET OUT.Definition: started or began a journey or mission

UNINHABITED.Definition: not lived in or occupied by people

DRASTIC MEASURES.Definition: extreme actions or steps taken to address a difficult situation

THE ODDS WERE AGAINST HIM.Definition: the chances of success were not in his favour

STAY PUT.Definition: remain in one place or position

GLACIERS.Definition: large masses of ice that moved slowly

FROSTBITTEN.Definition: affected or injured by extreme cold

GOTTEN WISE TO.Definition: become aware it or figured it out

ASHORE.Definition: onto the land from the water

MIRACULOUSLY.Definition: in a way that was very surprising or difficult to believe

SET FOOT ON.Definition: stepped or placed their foot on

PRIORITISED.Definition: gave higher importance or attention to

ANECDOTES.Definition: short and interesting stories or accounts

RANK.Definition: be positioned or rated in relation to others
